title: Lyndon B Johnson National Historical Park: Park Home
body: "All the World is Welcome Here"Â     ---Lyndon Baines JohnsonLyndon B. Johnson National Historical Park tells the story of our 36th President beginning with his ancestors until his final resting place on his beloved LBJ Ranch. This entire "circle of life" gives the visitor a unique perspective into one of America's most noteworthy citizens by providing the most complete picture of any American president. Read More               Touring the LBJ Ranch   While a ranger-guided tour of the Texas White House is a highlight of any visit to the LBJ Ranch, there is much to see along the way.        Second Floor of Texas White House Opens   On August 25, the park will offer special tours of the Texas White House that will include the second floor. Reservations are required.              Anniversary of President Johnson's Birth   To commemorate the 108th anniversary of President Johnson's birth, join us for the Wreathlaying ceremony at the family cemetery.        Movies Under the Stars at the LBJ Ranch    On September 10 Movies Under the Stars at the LBJ Ranch concludes for 2016 with the 1956 classic "Around the World in 80 Days"        Barbecue on the Pedernales    On October 22, join the Friends of LBJ National Historical Park for the annual Barbecue on the Pedernales.
